alert.note: Alert for Kauai Southwest (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 21 at 3:38PM HST until January 23 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING FOR THE NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND FOR THE NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF LANAI... .An extra large northwest (300-320 degree) swell will rapidly build late tonight through Sunday and will produce extremely dangerous surf. Waves could overtop lower roadways especially during the early morning high tides along north and west facing shorelines. ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM HST MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 20 to 30 feet along west facing shore of Kauai. * WHERE...Kauai Southwest. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 AM HST Monday. * IMPACTS...Very High. Expect ocean water surging and sweeping across beaches, periodically overtopping vulnerable coastal roadways with localized beach erosion. Wave runup could impact coastal properties and infrastructure, especially around high tides early Sunday morning. Powerful longshore and rip currents will be present. Surges and strong currents inside exposed harbors could cause damage to boats due to the jostling of boats and floating docks.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
